    Handles the export of the currently selected graph as a CSV file Also displays a warning if no graph is selected

    void
    handleGraphTypeSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    updates the gui based on the selected graph type and allows the user to change the date and time parameters also displays a warning for when custom is selected as the graph type, because we were unable to implement it in time

      public ReportsController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initialize the report gui by setting up the customization features (and hiding most of them initially) and populating the different graph types into the dropdown

    • populateGraphTypeComboBox

      public void populateGraphTypeComboBox()
      populates the dropdown menu for the different graph types that can be made

    • handleGraphTypeSelection

      public void handleGraphTypeSelection(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      updates the gui based on the selected graph type and allows the user to change the date and time parameters also displays a warning for when custom is selected as the graph type, because we were unable to implement it in time
      Parameters:
      event - the action event from the button click

    • generateReport

      public void generateReport(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      determines what graph to create, based on all of the inputted data also displays a warning if the start time value is larger than the end time value as well as another warning if the start day is after the end day
      Parameters:
      event - the action event from the button click

    • productUsageChart

      public List<javafx.scene.chart.BarChart<String,Number>> productUsageChart(LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate, int startHour, int endHour)
      Generates product usage charts based on ingredient usage data within a specified timeframe
      Parameters:
      startDate - the start date that the query will find
      endDate - the last day that the query will collect data for
      startHour - the hour for each day that the query will begin collecting data for (inclusive)
      endHour - the hour at which the query data collection will stop (exclusive)
      Returns:
      a list of BarCharts that are classified by their unit type

    • x_report_hourly_sales

      public javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<String,Number> x_report_hourly_sales(LocalDate selectedDate, int startHour, int endHour)
      generates the line chart for an X report in order to display total sales per hour within a given time frame and a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      startHour - the hour for each day that the query will begin collecting data for (inclusive)
      endHour - the hour at which the query data collection will stop (exclusive)
      Returns:
      a lineChart that depicts that total sales per hour for a given timeframe for a specific day

    • z_report_hourly_sales

      public javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<String,Number> z_report_hourly_sales(LocalDate selectedDate)
      generates the line chart for a Z report in order to display total sales per hour for a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      Returns:
      a lineChart that depicts that total sales per hour for an entire workday

    • x_report_items_sold

      public javafx.scene.chart.BarChart<String,Number> x_report_items_sold(LocalDate selectedDate, int startHour, int endHour)
      generates the bar chart for items sold per hour for a specific time frame on a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      startHour - the hour for each day that the query will begin collecting data for (inclusive)
      endHour - the hour at which the query data collection will stop (exclusive)
      Returns:
      a barChart that depicts the number of items sold per hour for a given timeframe for a specific day

    • z_report_items_sold

      public javafx.scene.chart.BarChart<String,Number> z_report_items_sold(LocalDate selectedDate)
      generates the bar chart for items sold per hour for a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      Returns:
      a barChart that depicts the number of items sold per hour for all work hours specific day

    • transactionTypes_xreport

      public javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<String,Number> transactionTypes_xreport(LocalDate selectedDate, int startHour, int endHour)
      generates a line chart showing each of the transaction types and how many times they are used each hour for a specific time frame on a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      startHour - the hour for each day that the query will begin collecting data for (inclusive)
      endHour - the hour at which the query data collection will stop (exclusive)
      Returns:
      a LineChart displaying the number of transactions per hour for each transaction type for a given time window on a specific day

    • transactionTypes_zreport

      public javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<String,Number> transactionTypes_zreport(LocalDate selectedDate)
      generates a line chart showing each of the transaction types and how many times they are used each hour for a specific day
      Parameters:
      selectedDate - the date that will be used in the query in order to process the correct data
      Returns:
      a LineChart displaying the number of transactions per hour for each transaction type for a specific day

    • exportAsPNG

      public void exportAsPNG(javafx.scene.Node chart, String fileName)
      exports the selected chart as a PNG image
      Parameters:
      chart - the created report that is selected and will be exported
      fileName - the name of the file that the chart image will be saved as on your computer

    • exportAsCSV

      public void exportAsCSV(javafx.scene.chart.XYChart<String,Number> chart)
      exports the selected chart as a CSV file
      Parameters:
      chart - the selected chart in a XYChart format so that it can be exported as a CSV

    • handleExportAsPNG

      public void handleExportAsPNG(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the export of the currently selected graph as a PNG file Also displays a warning if no graph is selected
      Parameters:
      event - the action event from the button click

    • wrapGraphForSelection

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox wrapGraphForSelection(javafx.scene.Node graph)
      wraps each of the graphs into their own VBox so that one of them can be selected, and then exported
      Parameters:
      graph - the graph that is being wrapped, so that it can be signalled as selected
      Returns:
      a VBOX containing the selected graph

    • handleExportAsCSV

      public void handleExportAsCSV(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the export of the currently selected graph as a CSV file Also displays a warning if no graph is selected
      Parameters:
      event - the action event from the button click

    • resetForm

      Parameters:
      event - the action event from the button click
